intro: Keetia ferruginea, commonly known as the rusty keetia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa, particularly South Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, often with a reddish tinge. Its leaves are simple, opposite, and usually have a rough or hairy texture. Keetia ferruginea is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
